p: The mutation E138A found both in rural and urban setting confers low-level resistance to second generation NNRTIs and their presence alone or in conjunction with the mutation M138I causes decreased susceptibility of the virus to ETV and RPV [ 43]. This mutation has been found to occur between 0.5 to 5% among na√Øve patients [ 44]. The mutation Y188YH (quasi-specie) found only in the rural setting renders an intermediate level of resistance to the first-line NNRTIs [ 45].
